def_en: A plate is a round or oval flat dish that is used to hold food.

def_cn: （尤指用于机械或建筑上金属制的）平板，薄板
def_en: A plate is a flat piece of metal, especially on machinery or a building.

def_cn: （通常置于办公室或住宅门边上的）金属姓名牌
def_en: A plate is a small, flat piece of metal with someone's name written on it, which you usually find beside the front door of an office or house.
See also:number plate; license plate; On a road vehicle, the plates are the panels at the front and back which display the license number in the United States, and the registration number in Britain.
Plate is dishes, bowls, and cups that are made of precious metal, especially silver or gold.
In printing, a plate is a sheet of metal which is carved or specially treated with chemicals so that it can be used to print text or pictures.

def_cn: （摄影中的）感光板，（玻璃）干版
def_en: In photography, a plate is a thin sheet of glass that is covered with a layer of chemicals which react to the light and on which an image can be formed.
A plate in a book is a picture or photograph which takes up a whole page and is usually printed on better quality paper than the rest of the book.

def_cn: （显微镜下的长方形）载物片，玻璃片
def_en: In a microscope, the plate is a small rectangular piece of glass onto which you put a small amount of the substance that you want to look at. You then slide the plate under the microscope to look at the substance.
A dental plate is a piece of plastic which is shaped to fit inside a person's mouth and which a set of false teeth is attached to.
In geology, a plate is a large piece of the earth's surface, perhaps as large as a continent, which moves very slowly.

def_cn: （棒球运动中）the plate 同 home plate
def_en: In baseball, the plate is the same as the home plate.

def_cn: 有很多工作要做；有很多事要处理
def_en: If you have enough on your plate or have a lot on your plate, you have a lot of work to do or a lot of things to deal with.
If you say that someone has things handed to them on a plate, you disapprove of them because they get good things easily.
